website_summaries.verdict: Portable design with 12 grips and handles for the most versatility at a reasonable price.
pros: Built to support up to 300 pounds, making it suitable for most users
Can be used flipped over for even more exercises
Slips over door frames for portability, but can also be mounted for permanent use
cons: Users note some black scuff marks on the door frame from the padding

customer_reviews.title: Broke during use! Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This product just broke during normal use. I weigh 195lbs and it cracked as I was doing my 10th pull-up. My window of return ended 10 days ago. Was great until it broke. Now it turns out to be a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Adam L.

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but be careful about doorposts.
customer_reviews.text: I liked this a lot. It does the job. I will say that you should be careful of ruining your doorposts. I took old t-shirts and wrapped it around the sides with duct tape, and that fixed the issue (check out the photos). It would be nice if it came with a solution rather than me inventing one.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Tablada

customer_reviews.title: Start Pulling Yourself Up
customer_reviews.text: Great Pull Up Bar It has so many grips on it I wrapped t-shirts around the parts that hang on the door so it does not damage the paint Now, I can do pull ups at home so I don't look like a novice at the gym
customer_reviews.author: Somil Madhok

customer_reviews.title: 2017 easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Just got it on June 5, 2017 easy to assemble. Love the product. I didn't expect it comes with 2 foams for the doorframe on the side which is very convenient I don't have to use my old shirts/towels to cover it, cuz i sont want any dent on my doorframe. Before I bought it i read the customer reviews and saw that people using their shirts to cover i was worried about that too but then when i open the package i saw those foams.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Do

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sure just having this hanging in my doorway automatically ...
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this for 6 months and am now buff as F***. Pretty sure just having this hanging in my doorway automatically gives me more defined abs. It did put unpleasant dents all up in my door frame and actual door, but then i wised up and lined that mother with some thick a$$ cardboard. Still worried about my scurity deposit tho. O well, at least I'm swole.
customer_reviews.author: helpful citizen

customer_reviews.title: Caution more like a 150lb weight limit!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'7" and weigh 240 lbs. This product has a listed maximum weight of 300lbs. I simply hung on the bars for the first time and they bent right at the joint in the center of the bar. I assembled it according to the directions and it fell apart without a single pull-up. Do not buy this unless you're under 200lbs and even then, buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping addict

customer_reviews.title: POORLY DESIGNED!
customer_reviews.text: Will only work on a door between 30.65 and 36 inches, otherwise the bar ends (see pics) will dig in to your doorframe and gouge it. Even then, with 185 pounds on it, it slips and peels the thin padding off the support bar allowing the metal to dig in to the top of your door frame. Bottom line: if your door is not within the dimensions specified, or if you weigh over 115 pounds, do not purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but needs more padding
customer_reviews.text: The part of the device that presses against the wall is padded, one half (the handles that go against your door frame) have optional extra padding included, but the other (the part above the door frame) only has minimal padding, the nuts stick out past that padding a little and will chip your wall's paint. It's a minor issue, but should be fixed. I'd like to see the bar above the door to have more padding or have indentations for the nuts to prevent this problem. Everything else is fine, the assembly is easy, the materials are solid, and the price is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew R.

customer_reviews.title: So many pieces
customer_reviews.text: So I was expecting a long solid metal bar. This thing ships in a small box and is in so many pieces I haven't even built it yet. It's like an Ikea pull up bar or something. I'll be honest I bought it because I'm lazy and thought I would workout more having a convenient pull up bar in my kitchen doorway. I bet if you are an active type you will totally have the energy to put this together and use it. It does feel sturdy. I weigh 270lbs and I would feel comfortable using this thing. I would think the doorway would break before this does (if it's put together right)
customer_reviews.author: EvilBob

customer_reviews.title: but my disappointment with this pull up bar has forced me to
customer_reviews.text: I do not often write reviews, but my disappointment with this pull up bar has forced me to. My biggest issue with this bar is that it has been deflecting more and more since I purchased it (See photos for reference). I don’t know if I received a defective item or the company just uses cheap material. I bought this bar because of how it extends away from the doorframe allowing for the great back pull-ups. It is supposed to come with cushion covers for the portion that lies against the door frame. Unfortunately though these pieces are oversized and consistently slip off. Consider carefully before buying
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Silberman

customer_reviews.title: Well made, if you use it according to instructions ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made, if you use it according to instructions and install the hanging hooks carefully you should have no trouble. I'm about 200lbs and have no issues using it for pullups in a normal household doorway or for pushups on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: ZSN

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but still very good
customer_reviews.text: Overall I really like this pull-up bar. I like that it provides a variety of grip options. It is secure on my doorway and can be easily taken down and put back up. The foam pad placed on the square tubing that rests against the wall above the doorway is insufficient to prevent the fasteners from gouging your wall. I placed some felt pads that were a little thicker, which worked well. I am about 200 lbs and the main horizontal bar does creak and bend slightly. I'm not concerned with it failing, but it is not solid (it is two pieces). The padded grips are good, but I can tell they are starting to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great pullup equipment for people who like to drywall!
customer_reviews.text: If you like to drywall this is for you! All you need to do is assemble, as instructed, and do a couple pull ups! Then remove the device. Like magic you will get two equally spaced dots over your doorway which will cause you to ask so many of your favorite questions, such as: Do I still have that can of paint for my room, will it match, do I think I can just leave it as no one will notice etc! Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Good bar poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: Poor mounting instructions. The placement of the wall mounted retaining brackets is too wide. It should be 10" from the center of each bracket between the brackets and not 15". At 15" the rectangle shaped bar does not seat completely in the brackets. Also put some frog tape on your door jam where the bar rests so it does not mar the paint. Otherwise good solid pull-up bar with multiple positions to challenge your muscles.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Stoll L.Ac.

customer_reviews.title: Quality controll ?? Missing hole
customer_reviews.text: My pull up bar came without one of the holes drilled. I'm a diy-er so I just drilled a hole in the spot it was missing and sanded off the burs but still not something I should have had to do. The bar itself is honestly great I like the multiple grip spot design a lot more than my old pull up bar. If you don't mind sending it back or drilling a hole yourself I highly recommend. If you're not willing to have that potential.. look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce The King

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: a co worker had one and I loved it. I ready a bunch of reviews and got this one. I put my in my bathroom closet door. It's very sturdy. It lost a star because it is putting small round holes where it hits the sheet rock. There is a foam pad there, but it's clear that the foam is there not to protect your house, but to cover screws poking through that the company doesn't want you to know about. My wife has not noticed the holes yet, and until she does I am good. lol wicked work out though!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Aaron Gurley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pull up bar - Should get Zero stars cause it hurts so much cause I am weak :-(
customer_reviews.text: Pull Ups are one of the best major body movement exercises. Pull Ups really challenge so many muscles they are hard to beat. This bar is great because it offers the option of holding onto the bar so many different ways. Once you make progress with your hands close together, try it with your hands far apart. enjoy starting all over. It's tough, but this bar has your back and will stand in your doorway taunting you to do better :-).
customer_reviews.author: Josh Peller

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous item, poor quality control - could not be assembled correctly  due to defective parts.
customer_reviews.text: Update: having made contact with the manufacturer they replaced the faulty parts and we are now able to use the pull up bar. Updated rating accordingly. The item as delivered was unsafe to use when assembled. The grips positioned incorrectly, too high on the handle bar and this prevented the main cross bar from being attached safely flat against the hand bar. I contacted customer service and so far have received no response. I need some new parts with hand grips correctly placed to allow assembly. Now because I have no reply from the manufacturer I have to take the time to disassemble and return for a refund wasting my time and multiplying my customer frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Fairy Girl

customer_reviews.title: Months Later: Great Condition
customer_reviews.text: I've had this pull up bar for a few months now, and I'm surprised by the durability. I expected that the bar would fall apart within the first month, and I'm glad to say I was wrong. It's important to note: the pull up bar will leave marks on your door way trim. If this is a big issue, I'd recommend putting toilet paper or some other cushioning material to prevent this. I'm over 6' and weight 190lb, and the bar is able to sustain my weight.
customer_reviews.author: J C

customer_reviews.title: Chin up bar
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a god product. It was an immediate hit with my 11 year old son who does a few pull ups whenever he walks by. Assembly was simple, mounting was easy, too. Caution, however: if your door casings are larger than 1x4 the self clamping feature will not work. Also be aware that door openings close to inside corners will force the being installed off center and with less protection for the casing.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Seems very sturdy, but does rock a little
customer_reviews.text: heavy duty indeed. had a little trouble with assembly as all the holes did not line up exactly. had to keep the screws loose enough that I could fiddle and fuss until it was fully assembled. Seems very sturdy, but does rock a little. There was some reviews talking about marking of the door frame. the padded ends are keeping that from happening, but am seeing some marks on the wall over the top of the door frame where the top part rests. Do not a place where I can leave something like this up all the time, so being able to easily put it up and down counts for a lot. the multi bar offers options.
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck pull up bar.  No screwing into the door frame for install.
customer_reviews.text: This bar is fantastic. Coming out of the box the pieces seem like alot to assemble but with the instructions it was a faster process than I thought. Upon assembly, I mounted it up so that the wood part was snug against the otherside of the door frame and made sure the door frame only made contact with the parts covered with foam. No screws into the door frame to keep this in place. There was very minimal black smudging that was easily removed with a magic eraser. It is very stable and works well with the many different hand positions I can use for a variety of hand positioning for wide or close handed pulls.
customer_reviews.author: J Tee

customer_reviews.title: Great product (so far). Do not assemble according to instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Like my headline states, it is a great product so far (I have only had it for a few days). It seems to handle my weight well but I wish it was a bit longer (no knock against the product, I just have long arms). Also, do not assemble it according to the instructions. Like many reviewers before me state, if you assemble according to the instructions, you will get stuck on the last step or two because the screws just will not go through their assigned opening. Get a feel for how it should be built and you will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Martinez

customer_reviews.title: BE SURE YOU HAVE EXTRA SPACE ON SIDES  OF DOOR FRAME
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think about needing EXTRA space on sides of door frame. Only one door in my home doesn't have an abutting wall too small to accommodate this unit. I took pics of a few so that you won't have the same situation, should you decide to purchase this unit. Well built, I only eight 103, but can't wait to work up to being able to do pull ups again!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Fullerton

customer_reviews.title: Good for pull ups, foam fell apart and chipped my doorframe paint
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve had this for about two week. As far as it’s usability, it’s a great pull-up bar. I’m definitely seeing gains. Not so good part: When I got it and put it together (which is quite the process) I noticed that some of the foam seemed impacted already like it was used. After about two weeks of use the foam where the bar contacts my door frame has worn away and chipped the paint off of my door frame. I’m not a heavy guy (140lbs), so this shouldn’t have happened.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great fitness addition
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a chin-up bar that could be used in my home. The Prosource Heavy Duty Doorway Trainer is a perfect match. It accommodates up to 300 pounds, can be removed from the doorway and put back again without disassembling the unit, and is instantly accessible whenever I need to work out with it. The hand grips are covered in sturdy foam rubber which makes the bar easier for me to use. A great addition to a home gym.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bandi

customer_reviews.title: No improvement needed.
customer_reviews.text: This came with everything you need to assemble. Took my time to do so and tightened everything a second time to finish up. No problem on my 30" door width and very stable ( 205#). Injured my wrist last year and this is the answer (for me) for push ups as well as chin ups. Cannot think of anything that needs improvement.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design flaw
customer_reviews.text: The reason this gets 1 star is because there are two big screws sticking out of the part that goes up against the door frame. Also both go ends of the tubes hit against the doorframe and leave big Mark's. Terrible design flaw. Do not buy this pullup bar unless you want to knock part of the wall and doorframe off!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Swezey

customer_reviews.title: Design Flaw Damages Wall Above Doorway
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy construction, and looks like they've responded to previous criticism and added foam on the sides, but there is still a glaring flaw where the bolts used secure the back bar protrude off the metal. This means, when you put any pressure on it, they take a big chunk out of the wall. I think I can get around it by wrapping a towel around it, but I didn't notice that from the beginning unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: Disfigured Piece
customer_reviews.text: Just got my bar. I was almost finished putting it together when I noticed bar #4 is messed up! There's supposed to be 2 screw holes but there's only one, they don't even line up with the other one. POS
customer_reviews.author: Tremaine Dawson

customer_reviews.title: More pros than cons
customer_reviews.text: The pros of this product far outweigh the cons. If you’re on the fence for other bars, I would recommend you choose this bar instead. It offers a ton of different positions for you to utilize which makes it much more valuable than a standard pull up bar. I like that it has the cushion to protect the door frame which I don’t think is always common with these products. The cons are that it is a little difficult to assemble, but it’s definitely doable, but better instructions could probably be supplied to make the product that much better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can install in a convenient location in your home
customer_reviews.text: This is great - it fits nicely in our door frame of our bedroom closet. Easy to put together and "install". (It is not a permanent installation - it fits nicely over the door frame and can easily taken down). You do need moulding around the door frame to use this. And it should be strong moulding as it will be holding your body weight. I need to have this is a convenient location as I use it many times a day - I hang from it to reset my spine due to scoliosis problems. The padding for my hands is very nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weak at mid-point for a heavy person
customer_reviews.text: I am over 200 lbs, so when mounted over the door frame when I try to pull up the bar starts sagging in the middle as there is nothing in to hold it in place there. The bar is decent quality but weak in the mid-point. If you buy it, make sure your weight is 150 lbs or less, otherwise this product won't work for you. I initially rated this at 3 stars but now downgrading to 2 since every attempt to use this product resulted in less than pleasant experience.
customer_reviews.author: globadda

customer_reviews.title: Solid bar, yet 'bends' each time I use it and does put holes in wall
customer_reviews.text: Feels solid, substantial, simple assembly. However, when use it, my body weight causes it to bend/shift/creak. Don't think the metal is bending, think it is moving/rotating around the door frame on top to settle into a position. Don't feel that it is unsafe, hopefully not. Also, the two screw on the top piece that goes over the door frame definitely puts holes in wall. They extend out past the thin rubber glued to the metal. I can live with that, but poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Sheck

customer_reviews.title: Went together fine
customer_reviews.text: I took the advice of a reviewer who said to look at the instructions first and then basically put it together without screwing anything in. You will see how everything lines up first and then you can connect everything so everything will line up. There are complaints where not all the parts align but I suspect that is due to putting in piece A and screwing it in tight before moving to piece B. It's really easy, just place them on the floor. It's not like Ikea furniture, more like a simple office chair.
customer_reviews.author: DJB

customer_reviews.title: This WILL damage your wall!!!
customer_reviews.text: Believe the bad reviews! It is NOT easy to assemble and not portable at all. It does NOT fit my standard size doorway in my house. This WILL damage our wall!! I put it together and did five pull ups just to test it out. Thankfully I was in the back of the house where the 2 indentations from the screw heads won't be very noticeable. Already printed my return label.
customer_reviews.author: Roy B.

customer_reviews.title: Buyer BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this at least 30 days ago & before I could use it, I injured my shoulder & never used it. I kept it in place on the doorway to my closet. Taking it down yesterday I discovered the foam material has discolored & stuck to the trim. The trim is painted but that was 17 years ago! Beware of this issue!
customer_reviews.author: Dad of All Trades

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pull-up bar. Picked this one over the #1 on amazon. Though it's a few more bucks than the other one: it's worth it!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I chose this pull up bar! Though I go to the gym and use their pull up bar, I wanted to have one at home so I could do more sets. I like that this one has different grips, just like the gym. I was worried when I opened the box and took out all the pieces and screws; I was worried that it would be too difficult to assemble but it was a cinch! And it latched onto my doorway very well. Gave it a few test pulls just to make sure it wasn't going to tear my doorway down. Overall, I'm very happy with this pull up bar!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca M.

customer_reviews.title: It is stronger than I thought.
customer_reviews.text: This thing went together easy even with the cheap throw away tools that come with it. It's pretty sturdy and I weigh 200 lbs. I hold onto the curved ends of the pipes that are farthest away from the doorway and they don't seem to flex at all. I like the different cross pipes etc that make it easy to arrange a resistance strap for an extended session with assisted pull-ups. Do yourself a favor and get that resistance strap with it, if you are horrible at pull-ups.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Terrible, the metal brackets included are so weak they bend while in use for the first time. I am well within the recommended weight limit. Also, it doesn’t work with half the doorways in my house, did 3 pull ups with it before the brackets were to bent to work, garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Kadamczyk57

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. It broke twice.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this item. There is a flaw in the design. I bought it, assembled it and the first time I put weight on it, the long bar, which is actually 2 shorter bars that connect, split open at the connection. I went through the trouble of ordering a replacement part (at least they had good customer service), but it broke again the first time I put weight on it again. I am 150 pounds. It has a 300 pound weight limit. This is terrible do not buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah K. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Nice grips, varied positions, solid construction, easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my son who does wrestling. He uses it to not only strengthen but to stretch his shoulders out keeping him flexible. My husband has shoulder mobility problems so he uses it to stretch too. Great that the grips are in different widths & positions. Nice padded grips. hooks up into place on any regular sized door frame. We just leave it there on the door frame of our spare room.
customer_reviews.author: quest

customer_reviews.title: Holes don't line up. Horizontal bar not parallel to the ground.
customer_reviews.text: The multiple grip options are great! Seems pretty sturdy. Only issue is that the holes don't align properly when assembling so you have to bend the bar in order for it to fit together. Furthermore since you have to bend the bar a bit, the horizontal bar isn't 100% parallel to the floor so one side is a couple inches higher than the other. I still use it regardless but I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great product that is super easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Great product and super easy to assemble. I only needed the picture on the box to assemble the whole thing. It is sturdy enough to hold me at 260 lbs with no problem. It fits better on wider door frames than it does narrower ones based on the way it fit the different door frames in my house. It works great as a push up bar, too. My girlfriend grabs a chair to use it and said she is glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: C. from TX

customer_reviews.title: Good product and enough variety for body weight exercises
customer_reviews.text: A bit hesitant that it might not hold or fit but I was not disappointed. Assembly is good, if you're in a rush then you have to reassemble again. You have to place a sock or wrap a towel so that the bars won't leave a mark on the side door, also have to place a tape or a piece of cardboard over the door so that those nails or so won't damage the walls
customer_reviews.author: Anito

customer_reviews.title: Bendy Bar?
customer_reviews.text: It works like a normal pull up bar, however it seems to have a lot of "give" to it. I tightened all the screws and YES, I know how to put together a simple pull up bar! I am a very light guy (less than 150lbs) and if I use the handles further from the center, the whole bar will bend slightly. If I use ones even further away, it will bend to more extremes. It works fine for me, and I do not worry about the construction of the bar. But for someone who weighs more than me, it might be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Sullins

customer_reviews.title: Cheap junk worth about $12.
customer_reviews.text: The same cheap pull up bar sold under other brands but with a higher price to trick you into thinking its higher quality. How sturdy can something be when tightened with junky tools and low quality screws, nuts, and washers? The parts are painted black but the paint wears away as soon as you try to tighten a screw. Once assembled the whole setup becomes loose and rackety in a couple days.
customer_reviews.author: michaelr

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, but leaves a mark on the wall.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, but left a mark on the door frame almost immediately. I had a feeling that was coming and didn't really mind. Important - do not tighten the screws before getting all of the screws in place and secure. I put together a lot of furniture and wouldn't rate this towards the highest of piecing together by hand (definitely not the worst though).
customer_reviews.author: Sam W

customer_reviews.title: Too small for my hands
customer_reviews.text: The space between the two horizontal bars that are parallel is too small for my hands. Also, I would recommend people install those bolts upside down so the nuts are pointed up. Additionally, there is too much padding on the outside bar that rests against the door frame which causes the bar to move as your body weight compresses the padding. Debating if its worth my time to take it apart and send it back, or just give it to a small person and buy a different one.
customer_reviews.author: lustro

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit 4" door frame
customer_reviews.text: I live in a historic house and specifically looked for one that would fit our 4" door frames. Several reviewers indicated this model would work and the specs state it'll work. It does NOT work. Our door frames throughout the entire house are 4" and there isn't a single place we can mount this. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jello

customer_reviews.title: WORST ASSEMBLY EVER
customer_reviews.text: This has been the worst assembly ever, and I've put together almost an entire house of Ikea furniture. The bars are not straight or curved the right way and had to force them to make the screws fit through. Finally assembled and the bar that sits on the door frame isnt even level. Also, the bar requires the brackets to be put on the wall, it doesn't just hang on the door frame like more simpler pull up bars do. returning this and purchasing another brand
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Could not even put together
customer_reviews.text: Got everything out to put together. Instructions say put the main two piece bar together. I have 2 pieces that are male. They do not go together. So I couldn't even put it together.
customer_reviews.author: Savy shopper

customer_reviews.title: Holes did not align...
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to get back to pull ups at home. While assembling I realized something was terribly wrong with the longest bar. The holes were too far out (I checked and double checked that the bar was properly connected in the center). The two curved bars attached to the padded board would have to be at a diagonal to match up to the holes, and at that point the screws don't line up at all. This may be a fluke, but I'm throwing this thing in the trash. I'm not going to bother returning since the box was damaged when opened. Learned my lesson. Hard pass on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: It could be fine but I wouldnt buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Its okay. I only weight 175 lbs but when i get on it groans. I dont feel safe using it. Also if you dont use the optional mounting bracket, it can fall easy. One kid closed the door forgetting i had the bar up and it fell leaving a second child needing stitches in his head. This would be great for 150lbs persons and less, and with the door removed, and the bar properly braced. For me its now just junk in the corner of the room.
customer_reviews.author: HEC

customer_reviews.title: Solid, does the job
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using a pull up bar. Assembly was easy enough. I put it on my door frame without screwing in. The first few times, I was quite worried about it falling or breaking the door frame, but eventually I grew comfortable with it. It's hanging by my walk-in closet, and I do some pull ups whenever I walk through there!
customer_reviews.author: U

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price, great results
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I wanted to build upper body strength and didn't want to join a gym. When I got it I could only do 1, but 3 weeks later I was able to start sets of 5. Now I can do sets of 5-10 consistently. It's amazing how quickly my upper body strength improved in such a short amount of time. I love the multiple grips. It's pretty easy to assemble. It does leave a little black mark on the doorframe from the black grip, but the mark comes off easily with a magic eraser. Would recommend to anybody who wants to add some upper body to their exercise routine from the comfort of their home.
customer_reviews.author: Leanna Balloffet

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Very decent pull up bar. Roommates always had one so I never needed to buy one until they moved. Assembly was quick, but I made the mistake of not making sure to keep the holes in line when connecting the middle sections. Took alot of effort to get them re-aligned. Chose not to mount it and tested all of the pull up sections and it feels very sturdy. Im 205lbs. Seems like it will last more than a few years so it's definitely a smart investment.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY BAD QUALITY= dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: Not sturdy , the pieces are not built even , feels like its about to break every time i do a set of pull-ups, very weak, cheaply made. worth about 5 dollars. Also screws need to be tightened after every use.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: I was sold a used/damaged product
customer_reviews.text: After opening the box, which I was excited to do, I noticed it was already open. Then I quickly realized that someone with an extremely low IQ had attempted to assemble it prior to me buying it. After further analysis I found that they had tried putting the long bolts where the short bolts were meant to go and stripped two of them. Of course, once they realized that they were no match for the complexity of this product they carefully put it back in its packaging and returned it only for it to be put right back on the shelf to be sold as a new. Unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Husband approves.
customer_reviews.text: Husband works out but due to covid, had to buy something for him to workout. Sturdy and had various ranges for different shoulder lengths. Better then the other simple single bar that we had purchased from another amazon vendor that came in a damaged box and missing bolts and screws. Needless to say, satisfied with this pull up bar.
customer_reviews.author: HTT

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great once you put it together. If you buy it sit down take a deep breath and get ready to frustrated. It is very difficult to assemble but I do like it. It is very sturdy. When I bought it I was concerned because I tipped the scales at 245lbs and it held my girth. I am down to 210 and can do 4-5 pull ups.
customer_reviews.author: Abdon Zambrano

customer_reviews.title: Needs enhancements
customer_reviews.text: I like the variety of grips, but the back side screw heads will dent or cut into your drywall, and the front side door frame protectors quickly become compressed and need supplementation. If this product were designed properly, I would not need to put socks on the ends and wrap a towel around the back side tension bar to prevent it from marring my doorway.
customer_reviews.author: Heavy Psi

customer_reviews.title: Worse Documentation than Most Codebases
customer_reviews.text: Unclear assembly instructions. Literally nothing is labelled on the packaging and the instructions say things like connect bar 2 and bar 1, yet the drawing labelling the parts is so unclear. Show each part as a seperate diagram to showcase how it looks not some fully assembled photograph. How am I supposed to differentiate between bars by looking at the assembled picture?!?!
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Its a well thought of piece of equipment. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Its a well thought of piece of equipment. I only gave it 3 stars because the spaces between the handles are small for an adult male's hands, also, a near-defect with the product is that where the device hits the door frame is a rigid hard plastic instead of a firm rubber and is destroying the wood on my door frames. I had to use my own makeshift foam to protect it and its very ugly.
customer_reviews.author: S. TIERNAN

customer_reviews.title: so it is actually pretty simple. It could have only taken 15 minutes ...
customer_reviews.text: Took me about 30-45 minutes to put the pieces together and hang and start exercising. It's not that it's hard to put together, you just have to match the holes up in a few places. Also the same bolts/screws are used everywhere, so it is actually pretty simple. It could have only taken 15 minutes but I mis-aligned one of the things and had to do again. I love the ingenious design of it where the more weight is hanging on the bar, the more resistance is on the other side of the wall. Just make sure you have a strong door frame.... It also does not hang very low from the top of the doorway.... Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will Damage Door Frame.
customer_reviews.text: Solidly built and assembles easily. On item to note: The screws that connect the flat tension bar to the top of the frame (this is the bar that goes above the door jam) - the screws are not flush or recessed into the tension bar. Consequently, you'll end up with scratches and small divots in the drywall above your door jam. Were it not for this issue, I'd rate it higher. Time will tell how good this setup is. I've only mounted it today.
customer_reviews.author: PKS

customer_reviews.title: I've never seen better packaging or thoughtfulness for a DIY-assemble product.
customer_reviews.text: I've barely even used it, and I hardly write reviews, but this product needs one. Right off the bat, the assembly was amazing. Super clear, easy instructions. Clearly labeled bags, with different parts in their own resealable ziplock bag. There was even a bag labeled extra parts, and had, well, extra parts! There was a cute mini wrench and an Allen wrench included as well. No tools of your own required. This is a perfect example of how packaging and assemble-yourself products should be shipped out. Very nice work.
customer_reviews.author: Akash B.

customer_reviews.title: Broke 1st use. Center bar bent and unit collapsed away from frame
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of not reading all of the reviews. This is cheaply made and will not support 200 lbs, no way will it support 300lbs Broke 1st use. Center bar bent and unit collapsed away from frame. Returning for refund immediately
customer_reviews.author: QA/QC Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Good product but a few complaints
customer_reviews.text: I used to have an iron gym but I gave it to my father since I'm a university student and am usually not home. I brought this because it was recommended and I like how soft the grips are but I noticed that it makes a very uncomfortable screeching noise when I use it that my iron gym never made. I don't really feel safe using this but it could also just be the way it's pulling on my door frame. This is still a great product but I really wish I didn't have to drill the safety brackets on my wall to feel safe using it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worthless... doesn't fit doorways without ruining them and pain to assemble
customer_reviews.text: The assembly is cumbersome and almost didn't fit right (I had to painstakingly slide a rubber protector that is not meant to slide). After all that, the foam protectors are nowhere even near large enough to protect the door jam, rendering this thing useless without some manual rigging. RETURNED
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Klisch

customer_reviews.title: This was a very easy peice of gym equipment to install
customer_reviews.text: This was a very easy peice of gym equipment to install. Once you understand which side of the bars to attach everything on...lol...it's a snap. It fit my door with no problems at all and I immediately started to do a test run. I don't even need to use to door brackets to keep it up it fits so snug. Maybe I have the right door for how this is made. . I would suggest to put a piece of foam or something to block the bolts on the bar that goes across the top of the door because it will leave a bit of a black smudge. Other than that, it works perfectly. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Good for pull-ups, not great for other exercises advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Works as a pull-up bar. The hardware it comes with is very sufficient to get it mounted in a doorway. It does flex when used, but I don't see any signs of it permanently deforming. I'm a pretty heavy guy (230 lbs.) and I feel confident putting my weight on this bar. As a dip bar, it's basically useless. Anyone who thinks the 5 inches of travel you get is an effective dip has not actually done dips. I disagree that it is marketed as such. Good pull-up bar for the price, though.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Z

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install and Use
customer_reviews.text: I used to have one of these a few years ago and gave it away when I moved. With gyms closed, because of the pandemic, I needed a bar to continue my workouts. The delivery came within a couple days. I was able to put it together in less than an hour. Of the 5 door frames I have in my apartment, it only fit on one though. Keep that in mind when purchasing and check if you think you'll have enough clearance on all side (left, right and top). It feels sturdy being 160lbs. I put a small thin towel under the foam mounts, so it doesn't leave a mark in the wall,.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: Will ruin your door trim
customer_reviews.text: After putting this together for my son and trying to put it over a/any door, I came to the realization any door way I put this at will destroy my trim. It is useless to me as I'm not willing to ruin and beat up my door jams. I wouldnt recomend this to anyone. Instead if you have the room just get a stand its worth it in the long run. Found mine for 50 locally the same day I figuered out this was going in the garbage can.
customer_reviews.author: Dk

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Takes a little pulling and lining up but it is doable. So I ask a product question about the clearance of this to the ceiling. I have a shorter basement ceiling. About 5 inches from door trim to ceiling. With this pull up bar I get a clearance of 11 to 12 inches. (More then enough for my big noggin.) so I have 4 stars on the easy set up. Not five because they could have added a bolt or two in the middle instead of the “twist” locking feature. Hope this helps anyone looking at this product.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Will cause damage, not sturdy or safe feeling
customer_reviews.text: To begin, you have to assemble the whole thing not the worst thing but not expected or clearly stated. Also not stated is the fact that once you do get the product assembled the ends of the screws/bolts will push themselves into your walls. If you aren't wanting to do damage to your walls with this product just don't get it. Once up the product doesn't do much of anything to sturdy itself. I'm not some big guy and I don't even want to try to pull myself up using the bar. Definitely a return for me I can't suggest it for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: BrJ

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure it's great....
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure it works great. I was an idiot and after getting it, realized the top door trim was super thick and this won't fit on it so I can only use it for pushups and dips but no pullups. Check your door trim before purchasing and make sure it's less than 2-3 inches. Mine is 6 inches.... *Facepalm
customer_reviews.author: Mike Graham

customer_reviews.title: Solid pull up bar with many grips, even if a bit bulky
customer_reviews.text: This is like the Swiss Army knife of pull up bars, as it has 5 different ways to grip, and has some other work outs that aren't pull up related as well. However, for me it is just a pull up bar, and it holds up my 200lbs quite well on a regular door frame. As others suggested, I put small towels between the frame and the bar to prevent damage. I particular like that it has a vertical grip, as I find that much easier on my shoulders. Kind of a pain to assemble, but overall worth it.
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly & use
customer_reviews.text: I read quite a few reviews before deciding which multigrip bar to buy. This sounded like an easy assembly and the least damaging. The day I received it I put it together fairly quickly and used it. I have two towels that are placed on my crown molding. I checked a few times for damaged/ dented spots, but didn't notice any. A few times I think I have heard it slip from its hanging position, but didn't notice any movement. Handle grips are still comfortable and plush. Only negative is that it's in a doorway that won't allow the door to close more than 90degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Rom

customer_reviews.title: Solid for its price range
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction and easy to put together. This product now comes with foam padding to reduce damage to doors (unlike what many of the older reviews state). However, it is fairly limited on the door thickness / trim height it can handle. My trim/door is 6.75" thick which is at the absolute max it can handle. My upper door trim is 4.5" and it could likely handle an inch more (but not if your door thickness is also at the max). At 6.75" thick, I could not use the included foam padding as it wouldn't fit, instead I wrapped a small hand towel around both sides.
customer_reviews.author: K Hu

customer_reviews.title: 2 Issues: assembly and door frame depth
customer_reviews.text: It's semi easy to assemble until you get to the last 4 screws in the steps and then I had to use a rubber mallet to complete the job. Once finally assembled I discovered this product would not fit my garage door frame due to the depth. All I noticed in the product details was your door needs to be 24-32" wide but nothing about depth. This did fit doors inside my house but my home gym is in the garage. Returning and will probably find a good wall mounted pull up bar.
customer_reviews.author: Andy PDX

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pull up bar.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pull up bar. Love the variety of grips to use,assembly was easy and fits on the doorway perfect. Feels nice and sturdy. I been using this amlost everyday for the past 2 months and its still in the same condition it came in. Love this bar,its well made. Great addition to the home gym.
customer_reviews.author: William.h

customer_reviews.title: Need more length for proper pull ups
customer_reviews.text: I had a pull up bar before but this 1 seems to have no leverage, it's clustered and difficult to get a correct grip. It's looks good but i don't like it, I'm a army man so I'm use to pull ups but this is not worth it. I feel like if i do a pull up my head is going to bump in my doorframe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this pull-up bar for a month now and couldn't be happier. The bar fits well over standard molding (it does not fit over overly tall molding; I would guess the cut-off to be about 3-5 inches). Assembly was easy enough. All tools were included. The bar is leaving some minor scuff marks on my door frame, but nothing overly noticeable. Much less obtrusive than a pressure bar. The bar feels sturdy. The grips are comfortable. The various grip locations are nice for doing different varieties of pull-ups. Easy to hang a pull-up assist band from as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Ruined my door frame and adjacent wall
customer_reviews.text: This product not only ruined my door frame and the adjacent wall, but it did that because the padding has already worn down in the few months that I have had the product. I am completely dissatisfied with the product, and I would not recommend to anyone. I will try to update with pictures when I have more time.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan M.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price all around
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was pretty simple and quick. I did have trouble figuring out how to get it up on the doorframe. My apartment has rather high and narrow doorframes with adjacent walls that are angled... but I got it to work! It feels sturdy enough... only if you do NOT swing at all. Only move straight up and down. No damage to the doorframe either. Overall, happy with it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soild build and perfect for upper body workouts!
customer_reviews.text: Great solid pull up bar that gives me room to do pull ups, chin ups, leg ups, and all the ups! Built sturdy and has cushions to put against the wall so it doesn't mark or scratch the frame. It's great overall but the cushion could be thicker and the bar that goes over the door frame should also have more foam between it and the wall. I didn't have one on the first time using it and it marked into the wall. Other than that, it's perfect for what you need it for!
customer_reviews.author: Mazda3

customer_reviews.title: This horizontal bar is strong
customer_reviews.text: My weight is 200lb. And I work on the horizontal bar without any problems, as soon as you get it, don't rush to do it right away because it leaves black marks on the walls, you need to wrap it with extra fabric and then train. horizontal bar consists of almost 15 minutes. I'm happy, but you need to make sure that it does not leave black marks on the walls and doors
customer_reviews.author: Mykola Sakharchuk

customer_reviews.title: Holds up well. Not hard to put together.
customer_reviews.text: Useful for when your quarantined inside your house. Using it a lot since I can't go to the gym right now. I only weigh 130 lbs so theres no issue of it flexing or breaking. Doesn't damage the walls or anything. Wish the grips were a little softer and ticker though.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon C.

customer_reviews.title: Husband
customer_reviews.text: My husband tried wrapping it with socks and shirts, but no matter what it still dents our frames. His previous one he had(different brand, don't remember), didn't do that. Everything else it does what it needs to. He's 5'7, 165, no other issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Pay cheap, pay twice.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the "ProSource Multi-Grip Chin-Up/Pull-Up Bar" for about a year. Right away, It damaged the paint and door trim. The plastic failed to protect the screw-heads from sinking into the back wall -- leaving a mottled line of dents and cracks. The foam failed to prevent the bar from denting the door trim on the front. The hand grips split within a few months. I have finally switched to the kind that uses screws in the door-frame, which is ironically less damaging than this one.
customer_reviews.author: stphen

customer_reviews.title: Design errors and tips/warnings
customer_reviews.text: 1. There’s a manufacturing error which makes metal bar that attaches to the wall non-leveled. This unevenness also makes it pretty hard to screw in the screws because the holes are not aligned anymore. 2. There are different size screws, just so you know. 3. Bar 4’s grip is slanted, so that means depending on how you attached it your grip can be slanted downwards or slanted upwards. So make sure you have it symmetrical on both sides. (I prefer my grip to be slanted downwards)
customer_reviews.author: Hutchinson Family

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money but it's not too secure
customer_reviews.text: First of all, its a very good product for the money. I am happy with the purchase although there is a downside that you have to take it off to close your door. I have one of those single pull-up bars from gnc. It doesnt seem as strong as the single bar. It moves everytime i pull myself up. A little scary. Fyi - i am 200 pounds. Overall it is worth the money. I only use it when i need a wide grip as my single gnc bar doesnt provide the wide grip option. Definitely secure your doors with some type of padding. It will scratch where it touches.. See the images posted by other users..
customer_reviews.author: Jaden

customer_reviews.title: Watch your grip
customer_reviews.text: I used this without issue for a week and then I made the mistake of switching to a suppinated grip. When I did this shifted the center of gravity and caused the bar to disconnect from the door hit me in the face and drop me on my a**. I was lucky I didn't land on my head but the cut on my face required 5 or 6 stitches.
customer_reviews.author: TXAMNZGuy

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This has been sturdy and works great for everything I've done on it so far. It has not marred up any of my wood work or sheet rock. The only thing I would like to see changed on it is the main bar is in 2 pieces. I would like to see one more bolt added at that seem to hold those 2 bars together.
customer_reviews.author: TerryB

customer_reviews.title: Overall good structural integrity
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly into any doorway to allow you to do a wide range of pull-ups. For those with small door jambs it comes with mounting brackets to make sure it stays secure. This bar can also be placed on the ground to help get a deeper range of motion whilst doing push-ups as well. Overall good structural integrity, however the foam pads seem like they will eventually wear out. The ends where the bar rests against the door frame will press and damage the frame, but some cloth or cardboard can prevent this.
customer_reviews.author: Ben W.

customer_reviews.title: damages door frame
customer_reviews.text: This has a poor design that has significantly damaged my door frame. I saw the prior comments about adding padding to the bar and I had intended to do that but wanted to try it out first. Big mistake. I'm pretty small and the first time I did a set on this bar, the ends dug into my door frame. Bad design.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT MULTI PURPOSE BAE
customer_reviews.text: I love this !! I bought this pull up bar a few months ago and I think it’s incredible. I’ve used it for pull ups and push ups (i’m not much or a workout expert yet) and I’ve already started to see some changes. This bar allows me to be able to push m body in new ways and I’m extremely happy that I ended up getting it. I’d recommend this to anyone, whether they a beginner or a pro. It really is a great tool to help improve working out at home.
customer_reviews.author: Damian Mattar

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Dependable.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for any doorway (lacking a door). Does put a bit of an indent in trim, I suggest putting socks on the parts that hit trim. Easy to put together, very sturdy. Been using this for some time now and no problems at all. All the different hand holds allow for many different types of exercise. Can also be used on the floor for certain pull ups and sit ups. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: pbrindles

customer_reviews.title: Damages your doorframe
customer_reviews.text: The grip material will leave black marks on your doorframe, the bar that sits above the doorframe has padding that's too thin so the bolts that hold that bar in place dig into your wall; there are people talking about wrapping the bars in socks or putting folded up cardboard in place to protect your wall, but why not just get a better pull up bar?
customer_reviews.author: s.pearson

product_meta.title: ProsourceFit Multi-Grip Chin-Up/Pull-Up Bar, Heavy Duty Doorway Trainer for Home Gym (ps-1109-cu), Black
product_meta.description: The ProsourceFit Multi-Grip Pull-Up/Chin-Up Bar provides an inexpensive way to tone and build muscles at home, without large equipment or marring your doorframe with installation screws. Designed to slip into any standard doorways, the heavy duty Multi-Grip Pull-Up Bar can be installed anywhere you have a sturdy doorframe from 24” to 36”. And if you have a permanent location in mind, it can also be mounted to the doorframe with the optional, included J brackets. 12 cushioned grip positions enable you to be able to develop your back, chest, shoulders, arms, and abdominal muscles with one simple piece of equipment. The bar now also includes 2 optional slip-on foam/PVC grips for the outermost handles to protect your doorframe. In addition to traditional pull-ups and chin-ups, the bar allows you to perform closed-wide angle and hammer grips as well as multiple leg raises and oblique curls. Built to last, the Multi-Grip Pull-Up Bar is constructed of high-grade steel for durability, safety, and long-term use. The bar can hold up to 300 pounds within a sturdy doorframe, making it ideal for a variety of users. This is one of the best pull-up bars on the market, yet we sell it at an incredibly affordable price to make home workouts convenient and accessible to anyone. Train like a pro, train with ProsourceFit!
feature_bullets: MULTIFUNCTIONAL – 12 comfortable grips & various handles allow you to perform wide, hammer, close-grip exercises
UPPER BODY STRENGTH - Strengthen entire upper body and abs with pull-ups, sit-ups, push-ups, dips, and leg raises; Material: Steel; Foam/PVC grips
EASY TO ASSEMBLE & INSTALL – Slip-in design fits standard doorways (24” to 36”). Includes 2 optional foam covers for outer handles to protect doorframes
AT-HOME WORKOUT - Portable design makes it easy to squeeze in workouts and stay fit at home; Exercise guide included
DURABLE STEEL - Made of high grade steel & built to last, it holds up to 300 lb. and includes a limited lifetime warranty

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
